page.title: 19Mr. Melsop's Farm
page.content: Mr. Melsop farms 45 acres,35 acres of this land he owns, the other 10 acres are rented. He has owned this land for 40 years and works it either by himself or with family help. Following Common Market regulations he finds it better to produce grass crops rather than any other arable produce. He uses it for fodder i.e. winter feed for his animals. He breeds Charolais cattle and a cross between Charolais and Hereford. The Charolais are bred for beef and the Hereford cross for milk. the farmer does not market any of his hay crops but the milk is taken to the dairy. He began dairy farming when he was 17, during the war.Then he worked with a herd of cows around Waverley Road. This farm was known for prducing the best milk in the area.
